Content_wSideColumn.Title: Nauvoo Student Tours: Itinerary
Content_wSideColumn.Abstract: Nauvoo Student Tours offers an itinerary with the items that are suggested to bring on the trip such as food and clothing.

Content_wSideColumn.BodyCopy:
• Student Itinerary Spring 2012

Other Esstential Forms:

  • Nauvoo Liability Waiver
  • Nauvoo Medical History Form
  • Nauvoo Tour Application

Food

  • Please plan to bring a sack lunch for Thursday and all the snack items you desire.
  • Snacks/cold lunch items may be taken on the bus to have in between meals.
  • The bus will stop at places that offer a variety of options for you to purchase - fast food, grocery store, etc.
  • Saturday breakfast, dinner, and Sunday breakfast in Nauvoo will be provided.
  • Food for Sunday's bus ride should be purchased Saturday for the return trip home.

What to Pack

  • Backpack or a carry-on item to have on the bus with you.  Include your pajamas, blanket, pillow, change of clothes, toothbrush, toothpaste, deodorant, etc.  Your suitcase will be stowed under the bus and will not be accessible until you reach Independence Stake Center Friday morning.
  • Plenty of snack foods for the bus ride
  • Money to pay for your meals
  • Scriptures, journal, and Hymn book
  • Camera (charged) with extra camera batteries
  • Umbrella, rain jacket, or poncho.  Plan on any type of weather; the weather can change quickly.
  • Sunscreen and sunglasses
  • Comfortable walking shoes that can get wet.
  • Church attire for Sunday Sacrament Meeting
  • Water bottle
  • Things to entertain yourself on the bus; for example, books, homework, and music.
  • Headphones if you bring music
  • Your temple recommend if you choose to do temple work in Nauvoo.

Remember

No shorts, capris, or flip flops are allowed on this tour.  As students of BYU-Idaho, you are representing the University.  The dress code is the same as if you were on-campus.
